name: Change Field Coordinates
desc: If you entered wrong coordinates before and wants to correct it, use this endpoint with corrected coordinates.

body.name: Points
body.desc:
All the boundary points of the field in a clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order. First point is referred as 'a' and subsiquent ones as 'P_1', 'P_2' and so on.
So if you have 4 points, use keys as 'a', 'P_1', 'P_2' and 'P_3'.

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

response.name: FieldID
response.desc: It is an identifier for the the field. It's unique for every field.

values.name: Invalid Payment Type
values.desc: Please send 'Payment Type' value as 1, 3, 6 or 12

values.name: invalid UID
values.desc: Please use the UID/API key you got after buying API credits. You check it at 'https://farmonaut.com/api'.

values.name: invalid crop code
values.desc: Crop code value should be from the values specified in this table. 🔗

values.name: invalid points format
values.desc:
Please send boundary points in clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order with keys as 'a' for first point, 'P_1' for second point, 'P_2' for third point and so on.
So if you have 4 points, use keys as 'a', 'P_1', 'P_2' and 'P_3'.

name: Change Field Crop Code
desc: It can be used to change the field's crop-code. Should be used if new crop is being cultivated at any field

body.name: CropCode
body.desc: Crop code for the crop being cultivated at the farm. You can find the codes to use for various crops here 🔗

body.name: FieldID
body.desc: It is an identifier for the the field. It's unique for every field.

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

response.successValue: Request submitted. New yield estimates will be available from the next satellite visit.

values.name: Invalid Payment Type
values.desc: Please send 'Payment Type' value as 1, 3, 6 or 12

values.name: invalid UID
values.desc: Please use the UID/API key you got after buying API credits. You check it at 'https://farmonaut.com/api'.

values.name: invalid crop code
values.desc: Crop code value should be from the values specified in this table. 🔗

values.name: invalid points format
values.desc:
Please send boundary points in clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order with keys as 'a' for first point, 'P_1' for second point, 'P_2' for third point and so on.
So if you have 4 points, use keys as 'a', 'P_1', 'P_2' and 'P_3'.

name: Change Language of Field Report
desc: Use it to change the language of field report of any field (multi-languages are supported). After change of language, the subsequent reports will be generated in those languages.

body.name: FieldID
body.desc: It is an identifier for the the field. It's unique for every field.

body.name: Language
body.desc: It should be list ISO 2 letter language codes. Currently supported languages are Hindi (hi), English (en), Bengali (bn), Punjabi (pa), Marathi (mr), Tamil (ta), Telugu (te), Arabic (ar) and Uzbek (uz)

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

values.name: Invalid Payment Type
values.desc: Please send 'Payment Type' value as 1, 3, 6 or 12

values.name: invalid UID
values.desc: Please use the UID/API key you got after buying API credits. You check it at 'https://farmonaut.com/api'.

values.name: invalid crop code
values.desc: Crop code value should be from the values specified in this table. 🔗

values.name: invalid points format
values.desc:
Please send boundary points in clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order with keys as 'a' for first point, 'P_1' for second point, 'P_2' for third point and so on.
So if you have 4 points, use keys as 'a', 'P_1', 'P_2' and 'P_3'.

name: Get A Single Field's Data
desc: It returns all the data for a single Field.

body.name: FieldID
body.desc: It is an identifier for the the field. It's unique for every field.

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

response.name: <FieldID>
response.desc: It's a map of all the data of a single field with key as that field's ID.

values.name: Invalid Payment Type
values.desc: Please send 'Payment Type' value as 1, 3, 6 or 12

values.name: invalid UID
values.desc: Please use the UID/API key you got after buying API credits. You check it at 'https://farmonaut.com/api'.

values.name: invalid crop code
values.desc: Crop code value should be from the values specified in this table. 🔗

values.name: invalid points format
values.desc:
Please send boundary points in clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order with keys as 'a' for first point, 'P_1' for second point, 'P_2' for third point and so on.
So if you have 4 points, use keys as 'a', 'P_1', 'P_2' and 'P_3'.

name: Get All Fields Data
desc: It returns all the data for all the fields in json object format with fieldID as keys.

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

response.name: <FieldID>

valueParams.name: CenterLat
valueParams.desc: The latitude of the center of the farm in decimal format.

valueParams.name: CenterLatLarge
valueParams.desc: The latitude of the center of the farm in decimal format.

valueParams.name: CenterLong
valueParams.desc: The longitude of the center of the farm in decimal format.

valueParams.name: CenterLongLarge
valueParams.desc: The longitude of the center of the farm in decimal format.

valueParams.name: Coordinates
P_x
valueParams.desc: 'P_x' denotes the (x+1)th point in the order. It has the latitude & longitude values as a Map.

valueParams.name: a
valueParams.desc: 'a' denotes the first point in the order. It has the latitude & longitude values as a Map.

The coordinates of the farm in clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order. The coordinates have keys as 'a' for 1st point, 'P_1' for 2nd point, 'P_2' for 3rd point and so on.. Minimum number of points would be 3

valueParams.name: Email
valueParams.desc: The email address associated with the field owner's account.

valueParams.name: Expiring
valueParams.desc: It tells if the satellite monitoring plan of the field is expiring soon or not. The possible values are 'yes', 'no' or null.

valueParams.name: FailedDays
<SatelliteVisitDate>
valueParams.desc: The value of this Map can be ignored, it's just meant to get the date value from the key.
The satellite visit dates at which no satellite data was collected due to cloud over the farm. The value is in form of a Map with date as the key and value as 'yes' String.

valueParams.name: FieldAddress
valueParams.desc: The street address of the field taken from google places API.

valueParams.name: FieldArea
valueParams.desc: The field area in sq. m.

valueParams.name: FieldID
valueParams.desc: It is an identifier for the the field. It's unique for every field.

valueParams.name: FieldLatLen
valueParams.desc: The different of the max and min latitude of the field.

valueParams.name: FieldLatLenLarge
valueParams.desc: The different of the max and min latitude of the field.

valueParams.name: FieldLongLen
valueParams.desc: The different of the max and min longitude of the field.

valueParams.name: FieldLongLenLarge
valueParams.desc: The different of the max and min longitude of the field.

valueParams.name: FieldMaxLat
valueParams.desc: The maximum latitude of the field.

valueParams.name: FieldMaxLong
valueParams.desc: The maximum longitude of the field.

valueParams.name: FieldMinLat
valueParams.desc: The minimum latitude of the field.

valueParams.name: FieldMinLong
valueParams.desc: The minimum longitude of the field.

valueParams.name: GenTif
valueParams.desc: Tells if the genTif image creation is enabled or not. The possible values are 'yes', 'no' or null.

valueParams.name: Health
<ImageType>
<SatelliteVisitDate>
valueParams.desc: The health value or the average index value of the image of the given satellite visit date. (range from 0 to 100)
The health values by image type and satellite visit date.
Health tells average value of indexes of different image types at different satellite visits.

valueParams.name: Name
valueParams.desc: The name associated with the field owner's account.

valueParams.name: OrderDate
valueParams.desc: The date of farm submission or the first monitoring order date.

valueParams.name: Paid
valueParams.desc: Is the payment done for the current order. The possible values are 'Yes', 'No' or null.

valueParams.name: PaymentType
valueParams.desc: The satellite monitoring plan choosen in the last order. The possible values are 1, 3, 6 and 12; representing the plan duration in months.

valueParams.name: SARDays
<RadarVisitDate>
valueParams.desc: The value of this Map can be ignored, it's just meant to get the date value from the key.
The dates at which radar data of the farm was collected. The value is in form of a Map with date as the key and value as 'yes' String.

valueParams.name: SensedDays
<SatelliteVisitDate>
valueParams.desc: The value of this Map can be ignored, it's just meant to get the date value from the key.
The satellite visit dates of the farm. The value is in form of a Map with date as the key and value as 'yes' String.

valueParams.name: UID
valueParams.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

valueParams.name: Weather
<SatelliteVisitDate>
cloud_cover
valueParams.desc: Cloudiness in %

valueParams.name: humidity
valueParams.desc: Humidity in %

valueParams.name: max_temp
valueParams.desc: Maximum temperature at the moment. This is maximal currently observed temperature (within large megalopolises and urban areas). Unit is Kelvin.

valueParams.name: min_temp
valueParams.desc: Minimum temperature at the moment. This is minimal currently observed temperature (within large megalopolises and urban areas). Unit is Kelvin.

valueParams.name: pressure
valueParams.desc: Atmospheric pressure (on the sea level, if there is no sea_level or grnd_level data), hPa

valueParams.name: station
valueParams.desc: Weather station city name

valueParams.name: wind_deg
valueParams.desc: Wind direction, degrees (meteorological)

valueParams.name: wind_speed
valueParams.desc: Wind speed. Unit int meter/sec.
The weather data at the specified satellite visit date.
The weather data at different satellite visit dates.

valueParams.name: Yield
<SatelliteVisitDate>
valueParams.desc: The yeild estimate value at the satellite visit date for the field. The value is in tonnes.
The yield estimation values at different satellite visit date for the field.

valueParams.name: hUnits
valueParams.desc: The number of hectare units utilized for this field. Know more about hectare unit by usage chart section.🔗

response.desc: It's a map of all the data of a single field with key as that field's ID.

name: Get Crop Solution Database
desc: It returns a list diseases of the crop and solutions to it with dose values in a Map datatype format.

body.name: Crop
body.desc: The full name of the crop that need to be requested, in lower case. The supported values/crops can be found here. 🔗

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

valueParams.name: formulation
valueParams.desc: The type of formulation of the solution to use. The solution might be available in different formulations in the market.

valueParams.name: dilution
valueParams.desc: The dilution to be used with 1L water.

valueParams.name: ai_gm
valueParams.desc: The Quantity to be used.

dummyValue.desc: The disease and solution data is returned in Map datatype with disease as key and solutions as value.

name: Get Field Area Index Image
desc: It returns a URL for the area index image of the requested field image. Area Index value tells the area which has a particular index value.

body.desc: It is an identifier for the the field. It's unique for every field.

body.name: ImageType

body.desc: The date of satellite visit for which image is needed.

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

response.name: url
response.desc: The URL of the requested image.

body.desc: This has only one value for now i.e. 'PDF'.

name: Get Field Satellite Image By Image Type
desc: It returns a URL for the requested field satellite image for provided image type, color map and sensed date.

body.name: Colormap
body.desc: The color-map for the image. Two values are supported- '1' used for good height vegetation, '2' used for small height vegetation. Colormap 2 is not available for TCI, ETCI, Hybrid, ColorBlind and Evapotranspiration images. See more about color-maps here. 🔗

body.name: FieldID
body.desc: It is an identifier for the the field. It's unique for every field.

body.name: ImageType
body.desc: The image type of the image. The supported values can be found here.🔗

body.name: SensedDay
body.desc: The date of satellite visit for which image is needed. The valid dates can be found in the 'SensedDays' parameter of the field data.

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

response.name: url
response.desc: The URL of the requested image.

valueParams.name: <SatelliteVisitDate>
valueParams.desc: The key is the date of satellite visit and the value is 'yes'.

response.desc: The satellite visit dates are provided as a Map with key as the date and value as 'yes'.

values.name: Invalid Payment Type
values.desc: Please send 'Payment Type' value as 1, 3, 6 or 12

values.name: invalid UID
values.desc: Please use the UID/API key you got after buying API credits. You check it at 'https://farmonaut.com/api'.

values.name: invalid crop code
values.desc: Crop code value should be from the values specified in this table. 🔗

values.name: invalid points format
values.desc:
Please send boundary points in clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order with keys as 'a' for first point, 'P_1' for second point, 'P_2' for third point and so on.
So if you have 4 points, use keys as 'a', 'P_1', 'P_2' and 'P_3'.

name: Get Weather Forecast Data
desc: It returns weather forecast data of next 7 days for the field.

body.name: FieldID
body.desc: It is an identifier for the the field. It's unique for every field.

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

response.name: daily
response.desc: It has the map containing all the forecast data.

valueParams.name: data
valueParams.desc: The forecast data Map with day-no in key and weather data in value. The day-no gives as 0, 1 upto 7 with 0 as today, 1 as next day and so on.

valueParams.name: <DataDayNo>
valueParams.desc: Weather forecast data for the day-no. The day-no gives as 0, 1 upto 7 with 0 as today, 1 as next day and so on.

valueParams.name: apparentTemperatureHigh
valueParams.desc: The human perception max temperature in the day. Unit is Fahrenheit.

valueParams.name: apparentTemperatureHighTime
valueParams.desc: The time of occurance of apparent max temperature in the day.

valueParams.name: apparentTemperatureLow
valueParams.desc: The human perception min temperature in the day. Unit is Fahrenheit.

valueParams.name: apparentTemperatureLowTime
valueParams.desc: The time of occurance of apparent min temperature in the day.

valueParams.name: apparentTemperatureMax
valueParams.desc: The human perception max temperature in the day. Unit is Fahrenheit.

valueParams.name: apparentTemperatureMaxTime
valueParams.desc: The time of occurance of apparent max temperature in the day.

valueParams.name: apparentTemperatureMin
valueParams.desc: The human perception min temperature in the day. Unit is Fahrenheit.

valueParams.name: apparentTemperatureMinTime
valueParams.desc: The time of occurance of apparent min temperature in the day.

valueParams.name: cloudCover
valueParams.desc: Current cloud cover probability ratio.

valueParams.name: dewPoint
valueParams.desc: The current dew point at the location.

valueParams.name: humidity
valueParams.desc: The current humidity ratio at the location.

valueParams.name: icon
valueParams.desc: Weather icon ID

valueParams.name: moonPhase
valueParams.desc: Moon phase. 0 and 1 are 'new moon', 0.25 is 'first quarter moon', 0.5 is 'full moon' and 0.75 is 'last quarter moon'. The periods in between are called 'waxing crescent', 'waxing gibous', 'waning gibous', and 'waning crescent', respectively.

valueParams.name: ozone
valueParams.desc: The current ozone value at the location. Unit is dobson unit.

valueParams.name: precipIntensity
valueParams.desc: The overall forecast summary in one line.

valueParams.name: precipIntensityMax
valueParams.desc: The overall forecast summary in one line.

valueParams.name: precipIntensityMaxTime
valueParams.desc: The overall forecast summary in one line.

valueParams.name: precipProbability
valueParams.desc: The overall forecast summary in one line.

valueParams.name: precipType
valueParams.desc: The overall forecast summary in one line.

valueParams.name: pressure
valueParams.desc: The current barometric pressure at the location.

valueParams.name: summary
valueParams.dummyValue: Light rain starting in the afternoon
valueParams.desc: The overall forecast summary in one line.

valueParams.name: sunriseTime
valueParams.desc: The sunrise time at weather station in timestamp format.

valueParams.name: sunsetTime
valueParams.desc: The sunset time at weather station in timestamp format.

valueParams.name: temperatureHigh
valueParams.desc: The max temperature in the day. Unit is Fahrenheit.

valueParams.name: temperatureHighTime
valueParams.desc: The time of occurance of max temperature in the day.

valueParams.name: temperatureLow
valueParams.desc: The min temperature in the day. Unit is Fahrenheit.

valueParams.name: temperatureLowTime
valueParams.desc: The time of occurance of min temperature in the day.

valueParams.name: temperatureMax
valueParams.desc: The max temperature in the day. Unit is Fahrenheit.

valueParams.name: temperatureMaxTime
valueParams.desc: The time of occurance of max temperature in the day.

valueParams.name: temperatureMin
valueParams.desc: The min temperature in the day. Unit is Fahrenheit.

valueParams.name: temperatureMinTime
valueParams.desc: The time of occurance of min temperature in the day.

valueParams.name: time
valueParams.desc: The time of weather data capture in timestamp format.

valueParams.name: uvIndex
valueParams.desc: The current UV index

valueParams.name: uvIndexTime
valueParams.desc: The UV index data capture time

valueParams.name: visibility
valueParams.desc: Average visibility, metres. The maximum value of the visibility is 10km.

valueParams.name: windBearing
valueParams.desc: The current wind bearing (in degrees) at the location.

valueParams.name: windGust
valueParams.desc: The current wind gust in m/s at the location.

valueParams.name: windGustTime
valueParams.desc: The time of wind gust data capture.

valueParams.name: windSpeed
valueParams.desc: The current wind speed in m/s at the location.

valueParams.name: icon
valueParams.desc: Weather icon ID

valueParams.name: summary
valueParams.dummyValue: Rain on Monday through next Wednesday.
valueParams.desc: The overall forecast summary in one line.

response.name: latitude
response.desc: The latitude of the weather station in decimal format.

response.name: longitude
response.desc: The longitude of the weather station in decimal format.

response.name: offset
response.desc: The timezone offset of the station location in hours.

response.name: timezone
response.desc: The name of the timezone

values.desc: Please send 'Payment Type' value as 1, 3, 6 or 12

values.name: invalid UID
values.desc: Please use the UID/API key you got after buying API credits. You check it at 'https://farmonaut.com/api'.

Please send boundary points in clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order with keys as 'a' for first point, 'P_1' for second point, 'P_2' for third point and so on.
So if you have 4 points, use keys as 'a', 'P_1', 'P_2' and 'P_3'.

name: Get Weather Forecast Data By Latitude & Longitude
desc: It provides weather forecast from the nearest weather station from given latitude and longitude. The service is available for any latitude or longitude, across the globe.

body.desc: The latitude of the location in decimal format.

body.name: Longitude
body.desc: The longitude of the location in decimal format.

values.name: Invalid Payment Type
values.desc: Please send 'Payment Type' value as 1, 3, 6 or 12

values.name: invalid UID
values.desc: Please use the UID/API key you got after buying API credits. You check it at 'https://farmonaut.com/api'.

name: Get Weather Graph By Date
desc: It returns a URL for the selected sensed date weather graph. Weather graph image consists of linegraph data for 5 parameters, namely Min./Max. Temperature, cloud-cover, humidity, pressure, wind-speed; for last 7 satellite visits.

body.name: FieldID
body.desc: It is an identifier for the the field. It's unique for every field.

body.name: SensedDay
body.desc: The date of satellite visit for which image is needed. The valid dates can be found in the 'SensedDays' parameter of the field data.

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

response.name: url
response.desc: The URL of the requested report.

values.name: Invalid Payment Type
values.desc: Please send 'Payment Type' value as 1, 3, 6 or 12

values.name: invalid UID
values.desc: Please use the UID/API key you got after buying API credits. You check it at 'https://farmonaut.com/api'.

values.name: invalid crop code
values.desc: Crop code value should be from the values specified in this table. 🔗

values.name: invalid points format
values.desc:
Please send boundary points in clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order with keys as 'a' for first point, 'P_1' for second point, 'P_2' for third point and so on.
So if you have 4 points, use keys as 'a', 'P_1', 'P_2' and 'P_3'.

name: Get Yield Estimates of a Field
desc: It returns the yield estimate in tonnes for the field.

body.name: FieldID
body.desc: It is an identifier for the the field. It's unique for every field.

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

response.name: <SatelliteVisitDate>

valueParams.name: Yield
valueParams.desc: The yeild value in tonnes.

response.desc: The yeild estimate comes in map format with key as date of satellite visit.

values.name: Invalid Payment Type
values.desc: Please send 'Payment Type' value as 1, 3, 6 or 12

values.name: invalid UID
values.desc: Please use the UID/API key you got after buying API credits. You check it at 'https://farmonaut.com/api'.

values.name: invalid crop code
values.desc: Crop code value should be from the values specified in this table. 🔗

values.name: invalid points format
values.desc:
Please send boundary points in clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order with keys as 'a' for first point, 'P_1' for second point, 'P_2' for third point and so on.
So if you have 4 points, use keys as 'a', 'P_1', 'P_2' and 'P_3'.

name: Pause Satellite Monitoring for a field
desc: It can be used to pause satellite monitoring for any field. User may use the remaining service units at any later time at the same field.

body.name: FieldID
body.desc: It is an identifier for the the field. It's unique for every field.

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

values.name: Invalid Payment Type
values.desc: Please send 'Payment Type' value as 1, 3, 6 or 12

values.name: invalid UID
values.desc: Please use the UID/API key you got after buying API credits. You check it at 'https://farmonaut.com/api'.

values.name: invalid crop code
values.desc: Crop code value should be from the values specified in this table. 🔗

values.name: invalid points format
values.desc:
Please send boundary points in clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order with keys as 'a' for first point, 'P_1' for second point, 'P_2' for third point and so on.
So if you have 4 points, use keys as 'a', 'P_1', 'P_2' and 'P_3'.

name: Request Historical Satellite Data
desc: It is used request satellite data from date before the start satellite service for any field. Eg. if the user submitted the farm on 15 June 2021 and wants data for date before 15th, say 5th June 2021, then can use this endpoint to request data for 5th June.

body.name: FieldID
body.desc: It is an identifier for the the field. It's unique for every field.

body.name: RequestedDate
body.desc: The historical date for which satellite image is needed.

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

response.successValue: Request submitted. Data will be available within 15 mins. Please check the SensedDays Key for confirmation in 15 mins.

values.name: Invalid Payment Type
values.desc: Please send 'Payment Type' value as 1, 3, 6 or 12

values.name: invalid UID
values.desc: Please use the UID/API key you got after buying API credits. You check it at 'https://farmonaut.com/api'.

values.name: invalid crop code
values.desc: Crop code value should be from the values specified in this table. 🔗

values.name: invalid points format
values.desc:
Please send boundary points in clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order with keys as 'a' for first point, 'P_1' for second point, 'P_2' for third point and so on.
So if you have 4 points, use keys as 'a', 'P_1', 'P_2' and 'P_3'.

name: Resume Satellite Monitoring for a field
desc: It can be used to resume satellite monitoring for any field. The system would start generating satellite data from next satellite on the farm, till service plan exhausts for the field.

body.name: FieldID
body.desc: It is an identifier for the the field. It's unique for every field.

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

values.name: Invalid Payment Type
values.desc: Please send 'Payment Type' value as 1, 3, 6 or 12

values.name: invalid UID
values.desc: Please use the UID/API key you got after buying API credits. You check it at 'https://farmonaut.com/api'.

values.name: invalid crop code
values.desc: Crop code value should be from the values specified in this table. 🔗

values.name: invalid points format
values.desc:
Please send boundary points in clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order with keys as 'a' for first point, 'P_1' for second point, 'P_2' for third point and so on.
So if you have 4 points, use keys as 'a', 'P_1', 'P_2' and 'P_3'.

name: Submit New Farm/Plot
desc:
It adds a new farm to your account with provided coordinates and enables it for getting satellite data (caution: it doesn't stop you from adding duplicate farms).

Once you submit the request it generally takes less than 15 mins for the first results to be generated. Once these results are generated they can be accessed instantaneously at any point of time.

body.name: CropCode
body.desc: Crop code for the crop being cultivated at the farm. You can find the codes to use for various crops here 🔗

body.name: FieldName
body.desc: One can give a name to the field to identify it easily.

body.name: PaymentType
body.desc: Number of months the satellite monitoring is activated for.

body.name: Points
body.desc:
All the boundary points of the field in a clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order. First point is referred as 'a' and subsiquent ones as 'P_1', 'P_2' and so on.
So if you have 4 points, use keys as 'a', 'P_1', 'P_2' and 'P_3'.

body.name: UID
body.desc: Also referred as API ID at some places. It's basically an identifier for your account.

response.name: FieldID
response.desc: It is an identifier for the the field. It's unique for every field.

values.name: Invalid Payment Type
values.desc: Please send 'Payment Type' value as 1, 3, 6 or 12

values.name: invalid UID
values.desc: Please use the UID/API key you got after buying API credits. You check it at 'https://farmonaut.com/api'.

values.name: invalid crop code
values.desc: Crop code value should be from the values specified in this table. 🔗

values.name: invalid points format
values.desc:
Please send boundary points in clock-wise/counter-clock-wise order with keys as 'a' for first point, 'P_1' for second point, 'P_2' for third point and so on.
So if you have 4 points, use keys as 'a', 'P_1', 'P_2' and 'P_3'.
